Articles.Content: Okay RIC, no problemo.
I think I might make a story in the fan works about this, is that okay with you guys?
ThatÃƒÂ¨s AWESOME! Can I be in it?
Yea, all of the player will be in it, but refered to by nations

Question Red crown: If we create an "international" mission/Kennedy moment, can we refer to the other players?

I'd really prefer that the thread stay away from making teams, it just causes problems.
Here's the begining of the story http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/136079-The-Kerbin-Space-Race

I'd really prefer that the thread stay away from making teams, it just causes problems.

Thanks RIC, I didn't really think that this thread was the best location for it anyway...just been too busy to comment...stupid school stuff...
Sampa, read the story so far
ok, could you make a small correction, please? My nation is called the United Kerbin Union (pretty much my joke on the United Nations and the United States (which is my home country))

K fixing

- - - Updated - - -

Fixed

K fixing

- - - Updated - - -

Fixed

Thanks!

Ok, update: due to recent stability problems from the new Esther launcher, the remaining one has been rolled back to the VAB to be checked over to find the source of the problems that is plagueing it. no launches have been made this round.

The Artemis 1 has landed, repeat, the Kanadian Space Agency has successfully landed a spacecraft into another celestial object WITHOUT crashing. As the rover it out of comm. range, our scientists tell us of a communication blockage, lasting up to 18 hours. The rovers first panorama will be taken then.

Has the UKU been to the Mun yet? I can't remember

- - - Updated - - -

Video of Artimis?
Traveler 5 will soft land on the Mun. Traveler 2 had impacted the Mun but this is to test tech for a future kerbal landing

The launch video of the Artemis 1 will be coming soon. With the new data, who knows what else we could do?

- - - Updated - - -

DidnI forget to mention that we are the first to achieve orbit around the Mun?
Ok, guys, I am going to have to temporarily drop out of the race. Getting too busy with my sociology final coming up and my Aero 34 midterm coming up. Will rejoin after those tests are done.

Okay Sampa, good luck!

Anyways, the Panorama image from the Artemis 1 rover has been transmitted:

- - - Updated - - -

3 space agency's have a kerbal in space, and 1 has it's first probe

Wait, when did the Kerbnese launch a Kerbal? All I saw are the Seer probes and just probes.

This was classified material, but now we'll make it official. Falcon 1 carried Patpond Kerman to 100 kilometers on a Longxing (Star Dragon) 1.We are planning to launch orbital missions on a Longxing 2 soon. Expect Mun flybys very soon

Okay, the recording of the launch has been uploaded:

- - - Updated - - -

A lesson has been learned looking back at this...\

Batteries need be included.
I think I'm going to take a play out of Kapoor's book and call an Elrond. Expect all of the coming missions to be first's.
By the way, did Patpond Kerman take any photos from orbit?

We only managed sub-orbit on the Longxing 1H, which is designed to put 2 tons into orbit. His craft weighed about 8 tons. No pictures were taken, this mission lacked a camera and a autopilot. Patpond spent the entire mission flying.

Leaked information: The Kerbnese are preparing a new rocket, one that could take a kerbal to the Mun.

Edited October 7, 2015 by MajorLeaugeRocketScience

Phoenix 2 is planned to land on the Mun. The only details Voyager Nation is releasing is it will be a direct ascent

Edited October 7, 2015 by Voyager275

Seers 4-6 have been cancled. Seer 7 will shock you all. Then, Falcon 2 will shock you once again.

- - - Updated - - -

You better hold onto your seats. Project Neutron will allow us to win this space race quickly.
